title: _meta
description: The `_meta` block providing sources and metadata for site data files.

items.description: A set of properties describing a "source." A source could be, for example, a homebrew PDF, book, or blog post.

json.description: An identifying string, as seen in the JSON in "source" fields.

abbreviation.description: Abbreviated form of the source, to display on the site.

color.description: HTML hex color code this source should use when displayed in lists, e.g. 'ff00ff'

full.description: Full title of the source, to display on the site.

authors.description: A list of authors who created the homebrew source.

convertedBy.description: An optional list of people who contributed to converting the source to 5etools format.

dateReleased.description: The date of release of the source, in the format YYYY-MM-DD (RFC3339).

url.description: A direct link to the source, if available in web form or on a store.

targetSchema.description: The target schema version in Pf2etools, e.g. "1.2.3".

skills.description: Object keys are Skill names, which can referenced using {@skill <key>} (case sensitive)

spellSchools.description: Object names are spell school abbreviations (e.g. `"X"`); values should be objects with `"full"`` (used in the main entry, e.g. "Evocation") and `"short"` (used in the list view, e.g. `"Evoc."`) key/values.

color.description: HTML hex color code this source should use when displayed in lists, e.g. 'ff00ff'

dateAdded.description: The epoch timestamp (in seconds) when the homebrew was added to the repository. Not guaranteed to be anywhere near accurate.

dateLastModified.description: The epoch timestamp (in seconds) when the homebrew was last modified. Not guaranteed to be anywhere near accurate.

currencyConversions.description: Keys should be uniquely-named value conversion objects, and can be referenced from item entities as "currencyConversion": "<MyKey>". The currency conversion info will then be used when rendering the value of the item.

mult.description: A multiplier for converting copper to this currency, e.g. "0.01" for standard gold pieces

isFallback.description: If true, this currency will be used as a fallback when the copper value of the item is a fractional value (e.g. a single ball bearing is worth 0.1 cp; marking gold as the fallback currency would have this be converted to gold).

dependencies.description: A map of `"<data property>": ["<JsonSource1>", ..., "<JsonSourceN>"]`. Entities from these sources can then be extended/referenced in this file.

includes.description: Structure as per "dependencies". Additional sources to be included when loading the file.

unlisted.description: If this homebrew file should be ignored/hidden by any indexer.
